title: Carl Esek Pray’s study of agricultural research in India measured the ‘productivity’ of laboratory experiments through an economic cost-benefit calculation. title: Dispute between ISI and IASRI: The ISI recommended that the crop-cutting area for estimating the total crop in a field should be circular, whereas the IASRI believed that the optimum shape of a crop-cutting unit should be rectangular. Later work showed that the differences in shape caused hardly any difference in the estimate of yield.
